intro: Cissus adenocarpa, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by local communities. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, making it well adapted to harsh conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to climb make it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
